required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Determine The Amount Of Voriconazole In The Brain After 2 Loading Doses And 3 Maintenance Doses Over 3 Days
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment Of Voriconazole Penetration Into The Brain By Fluorine-Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy

brief_summary.textblock: To determine the amount of voriconazole in the brain after 2 loading doses and 3 maintenance doses over 3 days and compare it to the amount of voriconazole in the plasma.

intervention.description: Multiple oral doses of voriconazole at 400 mg loading twice daily followed by 200 mg maintenance twice daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects must be willing and able to provide informed consent.
- Subjects must be willing and able to be confined at the Clinical Research Unit as required by the protocol.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with any condition affecting drug absorption.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Healthy male volunteers were recruited by 1 hospital center in the U.S. between March 2007 and August 2008.

group.title: Voriconazole
group.description: 400 mg every 12 hours on Day 1; 200 mg every 12 hours on Day 2; 200 mg on Day 3

group.title: Voriconazole
group.description: 400 mg every 12 hours on Day 1; 200 mg every 12 hours on Day 2; 200 mg on Day 3

outcome.title: Plasma Concentrations of Voriconazole
outcome.description: Mean plasma voriconazole concentrations (nanograms per milliliter [ng/mL]) pre-dose (Cmin) and two hours post-dose (C2h). Plasma samples were assayed using a validated, sensitive, and specific high performance liquid chromatography/tandem mass spectrometry (HPLC-MS/MS) method.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set: subjects included in the statistical analysis of pharmacokinetic parameters had the pharmacokinetic parameter of interest. N=number of observations (non-missing concentrations).

group.title: Voriconazole
group.description: 400 mg every 12 hours on Day 1; 200 mg every 12 hours on Day 2; 200 mg on Day 3

measure.title: Plasma Concentrations of Voriconazole
measure.description: Mean plasma voriconazole concentrations (nanograms per milliliter [ng/mL]) pre-dose (Cmin) and two hours post-dose (C2h). Plasma samples were assayed using a validated, sensitive, and specific high performance liquid chromatography/tandem mass spectrometry (HPLC-MS/MS) method.
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set: subjects included in the statistical analysis of pharmacokinetic parameters had the pharmacokinetic parameter of interest. N=number of observations (non-missing concentrations).

analysis.groups_desc: Other estimated parameter represents the Day 3 pre-dose ratio of the adjusted geometric means comparing brain vs. plasma concentrations of voriconazole. Natural-log transformed concentrations of voriconazole were analyzed using a mixed-effects model to obtain the adjusted mean difference (Test-Reference) and 90% confidence interval for the difference which were exponentiated to provide estimates of the ratio of the adjusted geometric means and 90% CI for the ratio.
analysis.estimate_desc: Estimated value = ratio (%) of adjusted geometric means comparing brain (test) vs. plasma (reference) concentrations of voriconazole.

analysis.groups_desc: Other estimated parameter represents the Day 3 post-dose ratio of the adjusted geometric means comparing brain vs. plasma concentrations of voriconazole. Natural-log transformed concentrations of voriconazole were analyzed using a mixed-effects model to obtain the adjusted mean difference (Test-Reference) and 90% confidence interval for the difference which were exponentiated to provide estimates of the ratio of the adjusted geometric means and 90% CI for the ratio.
analysis.estimate_desc: Estimated value = ratio (%) of adjusted geometric means comparing brain (test) vs. plasma (reference) concentrations of voriconazole.

outcome.title: Brain Concentrations of Voriconazole
outcome.description: Mean brain concentrations (ng/mL) of voriconazole pre-dose and 2 hours post-dose measured by Fluorine (F) Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy (F-MRS).
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set: subjects included in the statistical analysis of pharmacokinetic parameters had the pharmacokinetic parameter of interest. N=number of observations (non-missing concentrations).

outcome.title: Plasma Concentrations of N-oxide Metabolite
outcome.description: Mean plasma concentrations of voriconazole N-oxide metabolite (ng/mL) pre-dose and 2 hours post-dose. Plasma samples were assayed using a validated, sensitive, and specific high performance liquid chromatography/tandem mass spectrometry (HPLC-MS/MS) method.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set: subjects included in the statistical analysis of pharmacokinetic parameters had the pharmacokinetic parameter of interest. N=number of observations (non-missing concentrations).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
